citation.article-title: Paenibacillus castaneae sp. nov., isolated from the phyllosphere of Castanea sativa Miller.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Paenibacillus castaneae sp. nov.
Paenibacillus castaneae (cas.ta.ne′ae. L. gen. n. castaneae of a chestnut tree).
Cells of the single isolate of this species (strain Ch-32T) are Gram-variable and motile by means of polar and subpolar flagella.
No chains are formed.
Ellipsoidal subterminal spores are formed in swollen sporangia.
Catalase- and oxidase-positive.
Colonies on nutrient agar medium are yellow, round, smooth and convex with approximate diameters of 1–3 mm.
The only major quinone is MK-7.
The main fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0, iso-C16 : 0 and C16 : 0.
Negative in tests for anaerobic growth.
Grows at pH 5.7; optimal pH is 7.
Grows in 2 % NaCl, but not in 5 % NaCl.
Optimal growth temperature is 30 °C; unable to grow at 40 °C.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite.
Produces β-galactosidase, but not acetoin, indole, phenylalanine deaminase, urease, arginine dihydrolase, ornithine decarboxylase or lysine decarboxylase.
Hydrolyses aesculin, gelatin and cellulose, but not starch or casein.

In the API 20NE system, positive for assimilation of glucose, l-arabinose, mannose, mannitol, maltose and gluconate, but negative for that of N-acetylglucosamine, caprate, citrate, adipate, l-malate and phenylacetate.
Acid, but not gas, is produced from glucose.

In the API 50CH system, positive for acid production from l-arabinose, d-xylose, methyl β-d-xyloside, galactose, d-glucose, mannose, l-rhamnose, mannitol, maltose, melibiose, sucrose, trehalose, raffinose, gentiobiose and turanose, but negative for acid production from glycerol, erythritol, d-ribose, l-xylose, adonitol, fructose, l-sorbose, inositol, sorbitol, methyl α-d-mannoside, methyl α-d-glucoside, N-acetylglucosamine, amygdalin, cellobiose, melezitose, glycogen, xylitol, l-lyxose, d-tagatose, d-fucose, l-fucose, d-arabitol and l-arabitol.
Acid production from salicin and lactose is weak.
The type strain is Ch-32T (=CECT 7279T=DSM 19417T), isolated from the phyllosphere of chestnut trees growing in the Sierra de Francia region, Salamanca province, Spain.
The G+C content of the type strain is 46.0 mol%.
